actionUnits.condition: Allow Timeout.Start() on MonoBehaviour (fileID: 1094190426, guid: 9da68a9b408a56a4294168dd4694f0dc) to start coroutine ExecuteAfterTime(60). After WaitForSeconds(60), it should call canvas.SetActive(false). No m_Calls (UnityEvents) are defined on this object. This covers the coroutine path.

Simulate the input condition Input.GetButtonDown('Fire1') while Canvas is active so that Timeout.Update() (MonoBehaviour fileID: 1094190426) executes and calls canvas.SetActive(false). Note: Canvas has no Rigidbody/Collider/EventTrigger and the script has no public parameterless methods to invoke directly; this action represents an input simulation. If the previous task already deactivated the Canvas, a scene reset or reactivation is required before running this.

GvrReticlePointer (MonoBehaviour fileID 723926960, script guid e7dcc90c2e60c4011896c7f21fc1f557) is active and enabled. Start() already executed so MaterialComp is initialized from an attached Renderer and mesh created. Default serialized settings from scene: raycastMode=0 (Hybrid), maxReticleDistance=20, reticleSegments=20, reticleGrowthSpeed=8, reticleSortingOrder=32767. This trigger simulates a click press and release on the pointer to cover click handlers and material update.
